div.p: San Fernando Gardens Housing Project was built in 1955, as the only major public housing facility in San Fernando Valley. The housing project was intended to assist low income families whose average income is roughly $11,890(Hernandez). The 1949 Federal Housing Act created housing projects throughout the nation. These housing projects had a cultural legacy of poverty and were logical settlement locations for new immigrant arrivals from Central America. San Fernando Gardens Housing Project has 91 percent Latino population. As Susan Hardwick mentions, “...changes in immigration law in the 1960s opened the way for large numbers of new migrants from Latin America, Asia, and Africa to immigrate to the United States”(44). Suburbs of the San Fernando Valley would be ideal locations for recent arrivals. As shown through Census Data, 21 percent or more residents in the area are foreign born. These statistics highlight a community in transformation to a Latino immigrant gateway.

note.p: San Fernando Garden Housing Project represents a legacy of Chican@ settlement, that is transforming into a new suburban immigrant gateway.
